summary: The document is a classified 'SECRET' report detailing the shipment of a 1968 Chevelle Sedan consigned to Ivan Gabrilovich Alferiev, the Second Secretary of the USSR Embassy in Buenos Aires. The vehicle was shipped aboard the MORMACPRIDE, with operational details suggesting potential immediate offloading in Buenos Aires, even on a Sunday. The report includes specifics such as the bill of lading and dock receipt, with Moore McCormack Lines acting as agents for the USSR Embassy. This document falls under the President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act of 1992.
key_findings: The document pertains to a shipment under the President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act of 1992.
It involves the consignment of a 1968 Chevelle Sedan to Ivan Gabrilovich Alferiev, a Soviet diplomat stationed in Buenos Aires.
The shipment was transported via the MORMACPRIDE, with arrangements for possible immediate offloading in Buenos Aires, highlighting operational specifics.
Classified as 'SECRET', the document outlines the handling and logistical details of the shipment.
keywords: President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act of 1992
